org.deeplearning4j.models.embeddings.loader

Class WordVectorSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deeplearning4j.models.embeddings.loader.WordVectorSerializer

  • public class WordVectorSerializer
extends java.lang.Object
    This is utility class, providing various methods for WordVectors serialization

        public static WordVectors loadGoogleModel(java.io.File modelFile,
                          boolean binary)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the google model
        Parameters:
        modelFile - the path to the google model
        binary - read from binary file format (if set to true) or from text file format.
        Returns:
        the loaded model
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadGoogleModel

        public static WordVectors loadGoogleModel(java.io.File modelFile,
                          boolean binary,
                          boolean lineBreaks)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the Google model.
        Parameters:
        modelFile - the input file
        binary - read from binary or text file format
        lineBreaks - if true, the input file is expected to terminate each line with a line break. This is typically the case for files created with recent versions of Word2Vec, but not for the downloadable model files.
        Returns:
        a Word2Vec object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadGoogleModelNonNormalized

        public static WordVectors loadGoogleModelNonNormalized(java.io.File modelFile,
                                       boolean binary,
                                       boolean lineBreaks)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the Google model without normalization being applied. PLEASE NOTE: Use this method only if you understand why you need not-normalized model. In all other cases please use loadGoogleModel() instead.
        Parameters:
        modelFile -
        binary -
        lineBreaks -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                    Word2Vec vec,
                    @NonNull
                    java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the word vectors to the given OutputStream. Note that this assumes an in memory cache.
        Parameters:
        vec - the word2vec to write
        outputStream - - OutputStream, where all data should be sent to the path to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeWordVectors

        public static void writeWordVectors(@NonNull
                    Word2Vec vec,
                    @NonNull
                    java.io.BufferedWriter writer)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the word vectors to the given BufferedWriter. Note that this assumes an in memory cache. BufferedWriter can be writer to local file, or hdfs file, or any compatible to java target.
        Parameters:
        vec - the word2vec to write
        writer - - BufferedWriter, where all data should be written to the path to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • loadTxt

        public static Pair<InMemoryLookupTable,VocabCache> loadTxt(java.io.File vectorsFile)
                                                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                           java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Loads an in memory cache from the given path (sets syn0 and the vocab)
        Parameters:
        vectorsFile - the path of the file to load
        Returns:
        a Pair holding the lookup table and the vocab cache.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the input file does not exist
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • loadTxtVectors

        public static WordVectors loadTxtVectors(@NonNull
                         java.io.InputStream stream,
                         boolean skipFirstLine)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method can be used to load previously saved model from InputStream (like a HDFS-stream)
        Parameters:
        stream - InputStream that contains previously serialized model
        skipFirstLine - Set this TRUE if first line contains csv header, FALSE otherwise
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
